channel.title: Whats wrong with my code?:

item.title: Whats wrong with my code?:
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Here, this code works perfectly:

public class friendsName { public static void main(String[] args) { String[] friendNames = { "Liam", "Aaron", "Zahid", "James" }; int friend = (int) (Math.random() * 4);//Haven't used this in a while, if this doesn't give all names, try (Math.random() * 4) - 1; System.out.println("One of your friends is " + friendNames[friend] + "."); } }

Read full topic

item.title: Whats wrong with my code?:
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Ya it makes a random int with a max value of 3 or 4(haven’t had to used Math.random() in a while), and then it pulls the Friend name at the randomized index. I guess i could’ve used

int friend = (int) (Math.random() * friendNames.length);

instead of 3, but i couldn’t really recall the process very well.

So basically my code does this:

Create a String[] of all the friends names
Creates a random int with a max value of 3 or 4
Prints "one of your friends is " Then pulls the Friends name at the specified random index, concats it to the String.

Read full topic

item.title: Whats wrong with my code?:
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:2, topic:303395”]’=’ not “==”

public class friendsName { public static void main(String[] args) { String[] friendNames = { "Liam", "Aaron", "Zahid", "James" }; int friend = (int) (Math.random() * 3);//Haven't used this in a while, if this doesn't give all names, try (Math.random() * 4) - 1; System.out.println("One of your friends is " + friendNames[friend] + "."); } }[/quote]

An integer is not a String. iirc Your Random only works for integers.

ps:

public static int randomoriginalInt() {
    return originalInt[(int) (Math.random() * originalInt.length)];
}

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

‘=’ not “==”

public class friendsName { public static void main(String[] args) { String[] friendNames = { "Liam", "Aaron", "Zahid", "James" }; int friend = (int) (Math.random() * 3);//Haven't used this in a while, if this doesn't give all names, try (Math.random() * 4) - 1; System.out.println("One of your friends is " + friendNames[friend] + "."); } }

item.title: Whats wrong with my code?:
item.dc:creator: @ranger_squad ranger squad
item.description:
@ranger_squad wrote:

The plan:

[ul][li]There are 4 friends names.[/li]
[li]It picks a random one, and goes “one of your freinds are called Bob” or whatever.[/li][/ul]

My code: import java.io.*; import java.util.*; public class friendsName { public static string friendName == null; public int friendID[] = { 1, 2, 3, 4 }; public void changeFriends() { if(friendID = 1) { friendName = "James"; } else if(friendID = 2) { friendName = "Liam"; } else if(friendID = 3) { friendName = "Aaron"; } else if(friendID = 4) { friendName = "Zahid"; } } public void displayFriendsName() { system.out.printIn("One of your friends names is:" + friendName + "."); } }

The errors:

------------------------------------------------------------------------------- friendsName.java:4: ';' expected public static string friendName == null; ^ 1 error -------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Don’t just fix it, explain please, and fix.

Read full topic
